text: One distinguishing feature of business is its economic character which can be summarized as the conduct of buyers, sellers, employers and employees. A second distinguishing feature of business is that it typically takes place in organizations which is a hierarchical system of functionally defined positions designed toachievea goal or set of goals. Because business involves economic relations and transactions that take place in markets and also inorganizations, it raises ethical issues for which the ethics of everyday life has not prepared us. Decisions making occurs on several distinct levels: the level of the individual, the organization, and the business system. The level of the individual representssituationsthat confront them in the workplace and require them to make a decision about their own well-being.
